titleStmt.title: Mäṣḥafä gǝbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the commissioner. A few lines (5 and 3), divided into groups alternating with black lines, on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-10; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections (sometimes with a few alternating black lines); titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers in Text I-7; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; initial words in “Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text I-11); the words: yǝbe mätärgwǝm in Texts I-6, I-7, I-8, yǝbe in Texts I-6, I-7, yǝtärägwǝm in Texts I-6, I-7, I-8, ʾo-ʾǝgziʾǝnä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos mädḫaninä ḫer in Text I-9, ʾǝgziʾo täśähalännä in Text I-11. Abbreviations; tämälläs-signs; notes in the margins; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and/or their elements; elements of the text dividers and of quire marks.

msItem.note: - On fol. 139vc, Text I-9 ends with an embedded colophon. It states that the Ms. was written in the time of King Zärʾa Yaʿqob (r. 1434-68), whose throne name was Qwäsṭanṭinos, and of Metropolitan ʾabba Mikaʾel (s. EAE III, 956-57). In the note, the name <...> Krǝstos (the first part is missing) is mentioned as the commissioner of the book; it is not clear whether he is the commissioner of the present Ms. or of the Ms. from which this has been copied.

- On fol. 99va-b, the Homily of Jacob of Serug on Abraham (in Text I-8) ends with a subscriptio ascribing the translation of the homily (from Arabic into Gǝʿǝz) to Metropolitan ʾabba Sälama; besides, the authorship of the work is here attributed to Athanasius (Bishop of Alexandria from 328 to 373; cp. EAE I, 392): … [fol. 99va l.30] ወይሬሲ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ማኅደ[fol. 99vb]ሮ፡ ለአቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ጳጳስነ፡ ምስሌሆሙ፡ ደርገ፡ አሜን። ወለዝንቱ፡ ድርሳን፡ ዘአጽሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ጳጳስነ፡ ርቱዓ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ እምዓረቢ፡ ለግዕዝ፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞ፡ ኀበ፡ ዓምደ፡ ወርቅ፡ አሜን። ዘአጽሐፎ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ ተዝካረ፡ … ወይተሉ፡ ዝየ፡ ተጽሕፎ፡ ዘይቤ፡ አባ፡ አትናስቴዮስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ተሀሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ አሜን።
- The Homily by Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (Text I-10) ends with a note on the translation of the homily by ʾabba Sälama:
ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘተርጐማ፡ ብፁዕ፡ ርቱዓን፡ ሃይማኖት፡ አቡነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ። ይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ውስተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሕይወት፡ በሰማያት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።
- On fol. 150vc, Text I-11 ends with an exhortation to God for the ones who copied the book, the ones who caused it to be written and for the ones who read it. The note remains incomplete at the end.
- For the 11th day hour of Thursday the number is 9 instead of 11 (fol. 62va).
- In the supplication formula on fol. 65rc, the name of the individual to whom the note is dedicated has been erased.
- A ruled line has been left empty by the scribe between the text divider and the incipit of the section for the Day hours of Thursday (fol. 57va). The same is in Ms.GBI-002(fol. 57ra).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 152.0 folios, of which blank 1r, 2r, 2v, 3r, 3v, 152r, 152v, in 21.0 quires (A+19+B).
31.5 29.0 9.0

signatures.note: - Quire marks are written in black and red ink in the upper margin of the first and the last fol. of quires I-XVII (a few times only on the last leaf): ፩: fol. 11v; ፪: fols. 12r, 19v; ፫: fols. 20r, 27v; ፬: fols. 28r, 35v; ፭: fols. 36r, 43v; ፮ fols. 44r, 51v; ፯: fols. 52r, 59v; ፰: fols. 60r, 67v; ፱: fols. 68r, 75v; ፲: fols. 76r, 83v; ፲፩: fols. 84r, 91v; ፲፪: fol. 99v; ፲፫: fols. 100r, 107v; ፲፬: fols. 108r, 115v; ፲፭: fol. 123v; ፲፮: fol. 131v; ፲፯: fols. 132r, [፲፯] 139v. In some fols. the quires marks are written in pencil, in a recent hand: ፲፭: fol. 116r; ፲፮: fol. 124r; ፲፰: fol. 140r; ፲፱: fol. 148r.

list.item:
4 B(4/fols. 151r-152v).
Fols. 1-3 (Quire A) are of a smaller size.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been resewn. The board attachment has been repaired with recent synthetic cords. The spine cover is torn off. Fols. 147-150 are affected by humidity at the edges. Some fols. are stained with water (e.g., fols. 2-3, 138-140, 151-152).

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
- One ruled line was not used by the scribe at the bottom of fol. 136r.
- The ruling is not uniform and regular: the vertical lines are not always straight (e.g., s. fols. 109v, 110r, 111r). The scribe often disregarded the ruling.

handNote.date: Second half of the 18th – first half of the 19th century (?)

list.item: ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ in Text I-7 (fols. 68r, 68v)
ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ in Text I-7 (fols. 68r, 68v)
ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ in Text I-7 (fols. 68r, 68v)
ዲ፡ ያ፡ for ዲያቆን፡ in Text I-7 (fol. 68r)
ኦ፡ for ኦእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ መድኃኒነ፡ ኄር፡ in Text I-9 (fol. 120v)
ይተረ᎓/ይተረጕ᎓ for ይተረጕም᎓ in Texts I-6, I-7, I-8 (fols. 53r, 62v-64r, 90v, 90v, 100v)
እግዚኦ᎓ ተሣሃ᎓/እግዚኦ᎓ ተሣ᎓/እግዚኦ᎓ ተ᎓/እግዚ᎓ተሣ᎓/እግዚ᎓ተሣሃ᎓/እግ᎓ ተሣሃ᎓/እ᎓ ተ᎓/ እግዚ᎓ ተ᎓ for እግዚኦ᎓ ተሣሃለነ᎓ in Text I-11 (fols. 149v-150r)
ኦ፡/ኦክር፡/ኦክርስ፡ for ኦክርስቶስ፡ in Text I-7 (fol. 67v)
አምላ፡ for አምላክ፡ in Text I-7 (fol. 67v)
ይቤ፡ መ፡/ይቤ፡ መተር፡ for ይቤ᎓ መተርጕም᎓ in Text I-8 (fols. 82v-84v, 86r-86v, 90r-90v, 92r-v, 100v-101v)

handDesc.handNote: The handwriting is characterized by letters with a rounded and right-sloping shape.
- The numeral ፮ is with the loop open, looking like “compressed” ፯ (s. the quire marks and in the readings of the 6th hour);
- the letters ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (s. fol. 148va l.25);
- x-cross with dashes is used several times (e.g., fol. 11vb l.17).

list.item:
Fols. 1v: Excerpt from Gospel of John (Jn. 1:1-5).
The note is possibly written by the main hand. It is separated from the left side of the blank fol. by a vertical line.

Fols. 4r(upper margin), 8r (upper margin): Purchase note.Fols. 4r, 8r: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘአቡነ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ አበሰት[sic]፡ ዘተሣየጡ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ዛቲ፡ መቅደስ፡ በ[፷]ወ[፭]ብር፡ እለ፡ ስሞሙ፡ የሻቃ፡ አምነቱ፡ ቄስ፡ ገበዝ፡ ወልደ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ [fol. 8r] ዳኛ፡ ቄስ፡ ወልደ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ነባሪ፡ ቄስ፡ ወልደ፡ አቢየ፡ እግዚእ፡ አቶ፡ መንግሥቱ፡
The note (in black and red ink) starts on fol. 4r and continues on fol. 8r. It states that the Ms. was purchased for 65 bǝrr by the community of the church ʾAbunä Libanos ʾAmbäsät, namely yäšaqa ʾAmǝnnätu, qes gäbäz Wäldä Ḥawaryat. The "judge" was qes (priest) Wäldä Qirqos; other persons involved were qes Wäldä ʾAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ, ʾato Mängǝśtu (?).

Fol. 151r: Ownership note.Fol. 151r: ዝመጽ[ሐ]ፍ፡ ግብረ፡ ሕማማት፡ ዘአቡነ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ አበሰት[sic]፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወ{ዘ}ሤጦ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ እሱር፡ ከመ፡ ዲያብሎስ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ከመ፡ አር[er.]ዮስ፡ ለይኩን፡ በ<...>፫፻፡ በ፲ወ፰፡ ርቱአነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ውጉዝ፡
The note states that the Ms. belongs to the church of ʾabunä Libanos ʾAmbäsät. The note is written in red and in black. It is separated from the previous erased note by red lines and it is followed by the picture (in black and red ink) of a dragon (?) pierced by a sword.

Fol. 151v: Thanksgiving or petition prayer to God (kiryalaison). Fol. 151v: ኪይያ[sic]፡ ለይሶን፡ ኪርያላይሶን፡ ኪርያ፡ ላይሶን። … ለከ፡ ኃይል፡ ክብር፡ ወስብሐት፡ … ለአምላክ፡ ይደሉ፡ ክብር፡ …
The note, written in black ink, consists of three parts with connected content, of which the first part is separated from the second one through a black line and the second one from the following one by a simple uncoloured ornamental band.

- Supplication formulas for some individuals (donors?) are written in red in the upper margins (also in the bottom, as on fol. 46v, and in text area, as on fol. 8ra) of many fols., for the most part erased: e.g., fols. 30r, 33r, 39r, 42r, 44v, 45r, 47v, 49v, 51v, 54r, 55v, 56r, 59r, 59v, 60r, 64v, 66r, 74v, 79r, 80r, 89v, 91r, 100r, 111v, 112v, 113r, 133r, 135r. A sign in the shape of a cross (looking like tämälläs-sign) is inserted in the text column under each supplication, usually after the titles of the works to be read. The names of the individuals have been erased in all the supplication formulas, but in some of them replaced by names added by a second hand (in a different red ink): Gäbrä Tǝnśaʾe (fols. 59r, 113r), Gäbrä ʾIyäsus (fols. 59v, 113r), Wäldä Ḥawaryat (fols. 60r, 112v). - Excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (?) are written in red (decorated by thin lines above and below or chains of dots below) in the upper margin of fols. 88r, 88v, 93r, 93v, 94r, 105v, 106r, 106v, 109v, 110r. - Some notes have been completely erased on fol. 151r. A picture of two human figures (one of them an angel the sword?) have been drawn over the erasure, perhaps as drawing excercise. - Some notes (directives for the ministers?) added by a secondary hand (?) in the upper margins of fol. 11r-v: bä-mǝʿrab sämäya ʾAbrǝham bäl: fol. 11r (over col. a) zä-däbub wä-tǝbe Ṣǝyon bäl: fol. 11r (over col. c) bä-mǝśraq baräko Yaʿqob bäl: fol. 11v ʾOrit zä-lǝdät tärfa: fol. 81v. - Doodles and minor notes in pen and pencil: fols. 135r (inter columns) and 137r (upper margin).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather (partly missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover and turn-ins (at least 7 tools were used: double line fillet, triple line fillet, interlaced line fillet, triple sine wave, double circle, hatching, cross hatching).

origin.origDate: Second half of the 18th–first half of the 19th cent. (?)

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: “All the children” of the church, esp. Wäldä Ḥawaryat and yäšaqa ʾAmǝnnätu, are mentioned in Additio 2 as the purchasers of the Ms. The name of Wäldä Ḥawaryat is also written in the supplication formulas in the upper margins of fols. 60r, 112v. The names of other individuals are mentioned in other supplication formulas: Gäbrä Tǝnśaʾe (fols. 59r, 113r), Gäbrä ʾIyäsus (fols. 59v, 113r). In the colophon of Text I-9 (fol. 139vc), <...> Krǝstos is also mentioned as the commissioner.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
